thread.title: Harry Redknapp slams Dele Alli for horror tackle - 'he could have finished that fella's career'
thread.title_full: Harry Redknapp slams Dele Alli for horror tackle - 'he could have finished that fella's career'

author: Jacob Murtagh
title: Harry Redknapp slams Dele Alli for horror tackle - 'he could have finished that fella's career'
text:
The BT Sport pundit slammed Alli's challenge after Spurs crashed out (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Former Spurs boss Harry Redknapp had some harsh words for Dele Alli following Tottenham's dismal night at Wembley as they crashed out of the Europa League. 
Alli was sent off for a horror challenge on Gent midfielder Brecht Dejaegere five minutes before the break at Wembley, with Spurs chasing the game. 
Speaking on BT Sport after the match, Redknapp said: "He’s got to cut that out of his game, he’s got that streak in him. 
"I love him but that tackle is horrendous. He could have finished that fella’s career. Read More Alli receives his marching orders (Photo: PA) Alli hangs his head as he leaves the pitch after being sent off (Photo: REUTERS) 
"He’s lost his head. Look at that. 
"How the fella’s not got a broken leg I do not know, it’s a miracle." 
Alli appeared to be riled up after he felt he was fouled moments earlier before his reckless tackle earned him an early bath. 
It is the first time the 20-year-old has been red-carded in his professional career, although he has been booked five times so far this season. Read More Dele Alli sees red for HORROR tackle during Tottenham's Europa League clash against Gent Alli flies into Brecht Dejaegere 
Christian Eriksen had fired Mauricio Pochettino's men in front in their round of 32 second leg against the Belgian side. 
However, Harry Kane put through his own net to level the scores on the night and restore Gent's one-goal aggregate advanatge. 
Alli saw red, but the 10 men were back in front through Victor Wanyama to hand them a lifeline. 
But any hopes of Spurs advancing extinguished when Jeremy Perbet, who scored the winner in the first leg, netted an equaliser to send them through. Jeremy Perbet's scored in either leg to ensure Gent reach the final 16 (Photo: AFP) Spurs players hang their heads as they crash out at Wembley (Photo: PA) poll loading How long should Alli be banned for? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
